page.title: Species
page.introduction: In BioModels, species are used to create variables (molecular species) in reactions and fluxes. Species can exist in both membranes and compartments (volumes) of the cellular structures. Species are unique pools of molecules within a single compartment. If the same molecular component is present in multiple compartments, the compartment name is appended to the species name to retain a unique identifier, e.g. species_compartment.
page.appearance:
The Species Tab displays a table of the species name and the structure that contains it. If the species is linked to a pathway object, a link to that object will be shown in the Link column. Mousing over a link will open a tooltip box with additional information about the linked object. Double click on that link to navigate to the Pathway Diagram and highlight the object linked to the species.
The Species Properties pane is shown in the bottom right pane

operations.para: Edit A species name by highlighting and typing in either table or within the properties pane in the lower window.
Filter the list of species using the Search Box to enter a species name or a structure name.
Delete species by highlighting and using the "Delete Selected" button below the table.
If you wish to use Pathways Commons data, select the species and use the Pathway Links button.
Add annotation about the species within the Species Properties pane in the bottom window.
